section_title: Title and extent of operation of the Code
section_text: This Act shall be called the Indian Penal Code and shall extend to the whole of India.

section_title: Punishment of offences committed within India
section_text: Every person shall be liable to punishment under this Code for every act or omission contrary to the provisions thereof committed within India.

section_title: Punishment of offences committed beyond but triable within India
section_text: Any person liable by Indian law to be tried for an offence committed beyond India shall be punished according to this Code.

section_title: Extension of Code to extra-territorial offences
section_text: The provisions of this Code apply to offences committed by any citizen of India in any place without and beyond India.

section_title: Certain laws not to be affected by this Act
section_text: Nothing in this Act shall affect the provisions of any special or local law in force.

section_title: Definitions in the Code
section_text: Throughout this Code words and expressions are to be understood as defined unless a different meaning appears from the context.

section_title: Sense of expression once explained
section_text: Every expression explained in this Code is used in the same sense throughout unless context requires otherwise.

section_title: Gender
section_text: The pronoun he and its derivatives are used for any person whether male or female.

section_title: Number
section_text: Unless the contrary appears words importing the singular number include the plural number and vice versa.

section_title: Man Woman
section_text: The word man denotes a male human being and woman denotes a female human being.

section_title: Person
section_text: The word person includes any company or association or body of persons whether incorporated or not.

section_title: Public
section_text: The word public includes any class of the public or any community.

section_title: Queen
section_text: The word Queen means the Sovereign for the time being.

section_title: Servant of Government
section_text: The words servant of Government denote any officer or servant appointed or employed by the Government.

section_title: British India
section_text: The words British India mean the territories declared as such by law.

section_title: Government of India
section_text: The words Government of India mean the authority exercising executive power.

section_title: Government
section_text: The word Government includes the Central Government and State Government.

section_title: India
section_text: The word India means the territory of India excluding Jammu and Kashmir.

section_title: Judge
section_text: The word Judge denotes any person empowered by law to give judgment.

section_title: Court of Justice
section_text: The words Court of Justice denote a judge or body of judges legally empowered to act judicially.

section_title: Public Servant
section_text: The words public servant denote any person falling under categories mentioned in this section.

section_title: Movable Property
section_text: The words movable property include corporeal property except land and things attached to earth.

section_title: Wrongful Gain
section_text: Wrongful gain is gain by unlawful means of property to which the person gaining is not legally entitled.

section_title: Dishonestly
section_text: A person is said to do a thing dishonestly if he does it with intention of causing wrongful gain or wrongful loss.

section_title: Fraudulently
section_text: A person is said to do a thing fraudulently if he does it with intent to defraud.

section_title: Reason to believe
section_text: A person is said to have reason to believe a thing if he has sufficient cause to believe that thing.

section_title: Property in possession of wife or clerk
section_text: Property in possession of wife clerk or servant on account of that person is deemed to be in possession of such person.

section_title: Counterfeit
section_text: A person is said to counterfeit who causes one thing to resemble another intending deception.

section_title: Document
section_text: A document means any matter expressed or described upon any substance by means of letters figures or marks.

section_title: Valuable security
section_text: Valuable security means a document which creates extends transfers restricts or extinguishes a legal right.

section_title: Words referring to acts include illegal omissions
section_text: Words referring to acts done extend also to illegal omissions.

section_title: Words referring to acts include series of acts
section_text: Words referring to acts include a series of acts and words referring to omissions include a series of omissions.

section_title: Act includes series of acts and omissions
section_text: An act which is criminal by reason of being done with a criminal knowledge or intention is not the less criminal because it is done by several acts.

section_title: Acts done by several persons in furtherance of common intention
section_text: When a criminal act is done by several persons in furtherance of the common intention of all each of such persons is liable for that act.

section_title: When such an act is criminal by reason of its being done with a criminal knowledge or intention
section_text: Whenever an act which is criminal is done by several persons each of such persons who joins in the act with such knowledge or intention is liable.

section_title: Effect caused partly by act and partly by omission
section_text: Wherever the causing of a certain effect or an attempt to cause that effect by an act or by an omission is an offence it is to be understood that the causing of that effect partly by an act and partly by an omission is the same offence.

section_title: Co-operation by doing one of several acts constituting an offence
section_text: When an offence is committed by means of several acts whoever intentionally cooperates in the commission of that offence by doing any one of those acts commits that offence.

section_title: Persons concerned in criminal act may be guilty of different offences
section_text: Where several persons are engaged in the commission of a criminal act they may be guilty of different offences by means of that act.

section_title: Voluntarily
section_text: A person is said to cause an effect voluntarily when he causes it by means whereby he intended to cause it or knew that it was likely to be caused.

section_title: Offence
section_text: The word offence denotes a thing made punishable by this Code.

section_title: Special law
section_text: A special law is a law applicable to a particular subject.

section_title: Local law
section_text: A local law is a law applicable only to a particular part of India.

section_title: Illegal
section_text: The word illegal applies to everything which is an offence or which is prohibited by law.

section_title: Injury
section_text: The word injury denotes harm to body mind reputation or property.

section_title: Life
section_text: The word life denotes the life of a human being unless the contrary appears from the context.

section_title: Death
section_text: The word death denotes the death of a human being unless the contrary appears from the context.

section_title: Animal
section_text: The word animal denotes any living creature other than a human being.

section_title: Vessel
section_text: The word vessel denotes anything made for the conveyance by water of human beings or property.

section_title: Year Month
section_text: Whenever the word year or month is used it is to be understood as year or month according to the British calendar.

section_title: Section
section_text: The word section denotes one of those portions of a Chapter of this Code which are numbered.

section_title: Life imprisonment
section_text: In the Code the expression life imprisonment means imprisonment for the remainder of a person's natural life.

section_title: Punishment of offences
section_text: The punishments to which offenders are liable under the provisions of this Code are specified hereinafter.

section_title: Punishment
section_text: The word punishment includes imprisonment fine forfeiture of property and death.

section_title: Punishments
section_text: The punishments which may be inflicted under this Code are death imprisonment for life imprisonment rigorous or simple forfeiture of property and fine.

section_title: Commutation of sentence of death
section_text: In every case in which sentence of death shall have been passed the appropriate Government may without the consent of the offender commute the punishment for any other punishment provided by this Code.

section_title: Commutation of sentence of imprisonment for life
section_text: In every case in which sentence of imprisonment for life shall have been passed the appropriate Government may commute the punishment for imprisonment of either description for a term not exceeding fourteen years.

section_title: Definition of appropriate Government
section_text: In sections 54 and 55 the appropriate Government means the Central Government or the State Government as applicable.

section_title: Sentence of Europeans and Americans to penal servitude
section_text: (Omitted).

section_title: Fractions of terms of punishment
section_text: In calculating fractions of terms of punishment imprisonment for life shall be reckoned as equivalent to imprisonment for twenty years.

section_title: Offenders sentenced to transportation how dealt with
section_text: (Omitted).

section_title: Transportation instead of imprisonment
section_text: (Omitted).

section_title: Sentence may be partly rigorous and partly simple
section_text: In every case in which an offender is punishable with imprisonment which may be of either description it shall be competent to the Court to direct that such imprisonment shall be wholly or partly rigorous or simple.

section_title: Sentence of forfeiture of property
section_text: (Omitted).

section_title: Forfeiture of property in respect of offences
section_text: (Omitted).

section_title: Amount of fine
section_text: Where no sum is expressed the amount of fine shall be unlimited but shall not be excessive.

section_title: Sentence of imprisonment for non-payment of fine
section_text: In every case of an offence punishable with imprisonment as well as fine the Court may direct imprisonment in default of payment of fine.

section_title: Limit to imprisonment for non-payment of fine
section_text: The term of imprisonment for non-payment of fine shall not exceed one-fourth of the maximum term of imprisonment fixed for the offence.

section_title: Description of imprisonment for non-payment of fine
section_text: The imprisonment imposed in default of payment of fine may be of any description to which the offender might have been sentenced for the offence.

section_title: Imprisonment for non-payment of fine when offence punishable with fine only
section_text: If the offence be punishable with fine only the imprisonment shall be simple and shall not exceed two months or four months depending on the amount.

section_title: Imprisonment to terminate on payment of fine
section_text: The imprisonment shall terminate whenever the fine is paid or levied.

section_title: Termination of imprisonment on payment of proportional part of fine
section_text: If a proportional part of the fine be paid the imprisonment shall be reduced accordingly.

section_title: Fine leviable within six years or during imprisonment
section_text: The fine or any part thereof may be levied at any time within six years or during imprisonment.

section_title: Limit of punishment of offence made up of several offences
section_text: Where an offence is made up of several offences the punishment shall not exceed the punishment provided for the offence.

section_title: Punishment of person guilty of one of several offences
section_text: If a person is guilty of one of several offences the punishment shall be according to the offence proved.

section_title: Solitary confinement
section_text: Whenever imprisonment is awarded the Court may direct solitary confinement subject to restrictions.

section_title: Limit of solitary confinement
section_text: In executing a sentence of solitary confinement the confinement shall not exceed the limits prescribed.

section_title: Enhanced punishment for certain offences after previous conviction
section_text: Whoever having been convicted of an offence punishable with imprisonment commits a similar offence shall be subject to enhanced punishment.

section_title: Act done by a person bound by law
section_text: Nothing is an offence which is done by a person who is bound by law to do it.

section_title: Act of Judge when acting judicially
section_text: Nothing is an offence which is done by a Judge when acting judicially in the exercise of any power given by law.

section_title: Act done pursuant to judgment or order of Court
section_text: Nothing is an offence which is done pursuant to or warranted by a judgment or order of a Court of Justice.

section_title: Act done by a person justified by law
section_text: Nothing is an offence which is done by a person who is justified by law or who by reason of a mistake of fact believes himself to be justified by law.

section_title: Accident in doing a lawful act
section_text: Nothing is an offence which is done by accident or misfortune in doing a lawful act in a lawful manner with proper care.

section_title: Act likely to cause harm but done without criminal intent
section_text: Nothing is an offence merely by reason of its being done with the knowledge that it is likely to cause harm if it is done without criminal intent to prevent other harm.

section_title: Act of a child under seven years of age
section_text: Nothing is an offence which is done by a child under seven years of age.

section_title: Act of a child above seven and under twelve
section_text: Nothing is an offence which is done by a child above seven and under twelve who has not attained sufficient maturity of understanding.

section_title: Act of a person of unsound mind
section_text: Nothing is an offence which is done by a person who is incapable of knowing the nature of the act due to unsoundness of mind.

section_title: Act of a person incapable of judgment by intoxication
section_text: Nothing is an offence which is done by a person incapable of knowing the nature of the act due to intoxication without his knowledge.

section_title: Offence requiring particular intent committed by intoxicated person
section_text: In cases where intent is required a person voluntarily intoxicated shall be liable as if sober.

section_title: Act not intended to cause death done by consent
section_text: Nothing is an offence which is done by consent and not intended to cause death or grievous hurt.

section_title: Act done in good faith for benefit of a person
section_text: Nothing is an offence which is done in good faith for the benefit of a person by consent.

section_title: Act done in good faith for benefit of child or insane person
section_text: Nothing is an offence which is done in good faith for the benefit of a child or person of unsound mind by guardian.

section_title: Consent known to be given under fear or misconception
section_text: A consent is not valid if it is given under fear of injury or misconception of fact.

section_title: Exclusion of acts which are offences independently of harm
section_text: This section excludes acts which are offences irrespective of consent.

section_title: Act done in good faith without consent
section_text: Nothing is an offence which is done in good faith for the benefit of a person without consent in emergency.

section_title: Communication made in good faith
section_text: No communication made in good faith is an offence even if it causes harm.

section_title: Act compelled by threats
section_text: An act done under compulsion by threats is not an offence except murder and offences against the State.

section_title: Act causing slight harm
section_text: Nothing is an offence by reason that it causes slight harm.

section_title: Things done in private defence
section_text: Nothing is an offence which is done in exercise of the right of private defence.

section_title: Right of private defence of body and property
section_text: Every person has a right to defend his own body and property.

section_title: Right of private defence against unsound persons
section_text: Right of private defence extends against acts of persons of unsound mind or intoxicated.

section_title: Acts against which there is no right of private defence
section_text: There is no right of private defence against acts of public servants done in good faith.

section_title: When right of private defence extends to causing death
section_text: Right of private defence extends to causing death under specified conditions.

section_title: When right of private defence extends to causing harm
section_text: Right of private defence extends to causing harm other than death.

section_title: Commencement and continuance of private defence of body
section_text: Right of private defence of body commences and continues as long as danger exists.

section_title: When right of private defence of property extends to causing death
section_text: Right of private defence of property extends to causing death in certain cases.

section_title: When right of private defence of property extends to causing harm
section_text: Right of private defence of property extends to causing harm other than death.

section_title: Commencement and continuance of private defence of property
section_text: Right of private defence of property continues while danger exists.

section_title: Right of private defence against deadly assault
section_text: Right of private defence extends even if it risks harm to innocent persons.

section_title: Abetment of a thing
section_text: A person abets the doing of a thing who instigates any person to do that thing or engages in a conspiracy or intentionally aids by act or illegal omission.

section_title: Abettor
section_text: A person who abets the commission of an offence is an abettor.

section_title: Abetment in India of offences outside India
section_text: A person abets an offence within India if he abets the commission of an act outside India which would be an offence if committed in India.

section_title: Punishment of abetment if offence committed
section_text: If the act abetted is committed the abettor is punished with the punishment provided for the offence.

section_title: Punishment of abetment if person abetted does act with different intention
section_text: If the person abetted commits the act with a different intention the abettor is punished according to his intention.

section_title: Liability of abettor when one act abetted and different act done
section_text: When an act abetted and a different act is done the abettor is liable for the act done if it was probable.

section_title: Abettor liable for cumulative punishment
section_text: An abettor is liable for cumulative punishment for acts committed in pursuance of abetment.

section_title: Liability of abettor for effect caused
section_text: An abettor is liable for the effect caused by the act abetted.

section_title: Abettor present when offence committed
section_text: If the abettor is present at the time of commission he is treated as a principal offender.

section_title: Abetment of offence punishable with death or life imprisonment
section_text: Abetment of an offence punishable with death or imprisonment for life is punishable.

section_title: Abetment of offence punishable with imprisonment
section_text: Abetment of an offence punishable with imprisonment is punishable.

section_title: Abetting commission of offence by the public
section_text: Abetting the commission of an offence by the public or more than ten persons is punishable.

section_title: Concealing design to commit offence punishable with death or life imprisonment
section_text: Concealing a design to commit an offence punishable with death or life imprisonment is punishable.

section_title: Public servant concealing design to commit offence
section_text: A public servant concealing a design to commit an offence is punishable.

section_title: Concealing design to commit offence punishable with imprisonment
section_text: Concealing a design to commit an offence punishable with imprisonment is punishable.

section_title: Definition of criminal conspiracy
section_text: When two or more persons agree to do an illegal act or a legal act by illegal means it is a criminal conspiracy.

section_title: Punishment of criminal conspiracy
section_text: Whoever is a party to a criminal conspiracy shall be punished according to the nature of the conspiracy.

section_title: Waging war against the Government of India
section_text: Whoever wages war against the Government of India or attempts to wage such war shall be punished with death or imprisonment for life.

section_title: Conspiracy to commit offences punishable by section 121
section_text: Whoever conspires to commit any offence punishable by section 121 shall be punished.

section_title: Collecting arms with intention of waging war
section_text: Whoever collects arms or ammunition with intention of waging war against the Government of India shall be punished.

section_title: Concealing with intent to facilitate design to wage war
section_text: Whoever conceals a design to wage war against the Government of India shall be punished.

section_title: Assaulting President Governor etc with intent to compel
section_text: Whoever assaults or restrains the President or Governor with intent to compel shall be punished.

section_title: Sedition
section_text: Whoever by words signs or representation brings hatred or contempt or excites disaffection towards the Government established by law shall be punished.

section_title: Waging war against any Asiatic power in alliance with Government of India
section_text: Whoever wages war against any Asiatic power in alliance with the Government of India shall be punished.

section_title: Committing depredation on territories of power at peace with Government of India
section_text: Whoever commits depredation on territories of a power at peace with Government of India shall be punished.

section_title: Receiving property taken by war or depredation
section_text: Whoever knowingly receives property taken by war or depredation shall be punished.

section_title: Public servant voluntarily allowing prisoner of State to escape
section_text: A public servant who allows a prisoner of State to escape shall be punished.

section_title: Public servant negligently suffering prisoner of State to escape
section_text: A public servant negligently suffering a prisoner of State to escape shall be punished.

section_title: Aiding escape of rescue of or harbouring prisoner of State
section_text: Whoever aids the escape of a prisoner of State or harbours such prisoner shall be punished.

section_title: Abetting mutiny or attempting to seduce soldier sailor or airman
section_text: Whoever abets mutiny or attempts to seduce military personnel from duty shall be punished.

section_title: Abetment of mutiny if mutiny committed
section_text: Abetment of mutiny is punishable if mutiny is committed.

section_title: Abetment of mutiny if mutiny not committed
section_text: Abetment of mutiny is punishable even if mutiny is not committed.

section_title: Abetment of assault by soldier sailor or airman
section_text: Abetment of assault by military personnel on superior officer is punishable.

section_title: Abetment of desertion of soldier sailor or airman
section_text: Abetment of desertion by military personnel is punishable.

section_title: Harbouring deserter
section_text: Whoever harbours a deserter shall be punished.

section_title: Deserter concealed on board merchant vessel
section_text: If a deserter is concealed on a merchant vessel the offence is punishable.

section_title: Abetment of act of insubordination by soldier sailor or airman
section_text: Abetment of insubordination by armed forces personnel is punishable.

section_title: Persons subject to certain Acts
section_text: This section applies to persons subject to military naval or air force law.

section_title: Wearing garb or carrying token used by soldier sailor or airman
section_text: Wearing military garb or carrying token with intent to deceive shall be punished.

section_title: Unlawful assembly
section_text: An assembly of five or more persons is designated an unlawful assembly if the common object of the persons composing that assembly is to commit an offence or other acts specified.

section_title: Being member of unlawful assembly
section_text: Whoever is aware of facts which render any assembly an unlawful assembly and intentionally joins it is said to be a member.

section_title: Punishment
section_text: Whoever is a member of an unlawful assembly shall be punished.

section_title: Joining unlawful assembly armed with deadly weapon
section_text: Whoever joins an unlawful assembly armed with a deadly weapon shall be punished.

section_title: Joining or continuing in unlawful assembly knowing it has been commanded to disperse
section_text: Whoever joins or continues in an unlawful assembly knowing that it has been commanded to disperse shall be punished.

section_title: Rioting
section_text: Whenever force or violence is used by an unlawful assembly in prosecution of the common object it is rioting.

section_title: Punishment for rioting
section_text: Whoever is guilty of rioting shall be punished.

section_title: Rioting armed with deadly weapon
section_text: Whoever is guilty of rioting armed with a deadly weapon shall be punished.

section_title: Every member of unlawful assembly guilty of offence committed in prosecution of common object
section_text: If an offence is committed by any member of an unlawful assembly every member is guilty of that offence.

section_title: Hiring or conniving at hiring of persons to join unlawful assembly
section_text: Whoever hires or connives at hiring persons to join an unlawful assembly shall be punished.

section_title: Knowingly joining or continuing in assembly of five or more after it has been commanded to disperse
section_text: Whoever knowingly joins or continues in such assembly after command to disperse shall be punished.

section_title: Assaulting or obstructing public servant when suppressing riot
section_text: Whoever assaults or obstructs a public servant engaged in suppressing a riot shall be punished.

section_title: Wantonly giving provocation with intent to cause riot
section_text: Whoever malignantly or wantonly gives provocation intending to cause riot shall be punished.

section_title: Promoting enmity between different groups
section_text: Whoever promotes enmity between different groups on grounds such as religion race etc shall be punished.

section_title: Imputations prejudicial to national integration
section_text: Whoever makes assertions prejudicial to national integration shall be punished.

section_title: Owner or occupier of land on which unlawful assembly is held
section_text: Owner or occupier who knowingly permits unlawful assembly on land shall be punished.

section_title: Liability of person for whose benefit riot is committed
section_text: Whoever benefits from riot may be held liable.

section_title: Liability of agent of owner or occupier
section_text: Agent of owner or occupier permitting riot shall be punished.

section_title: Harbouring persons hired for unlawful assembly
section_text: Whoever harbours persons hired for unlawful assembly shall be punished.

section_title: Being hired to take part in unlawful assembly
section_text: Whoever is hired to take part in an unlawful assembly shall be punished.

section_title: Affray
section_text: When two or more persons fight in a public place disturbing peace it is an affray.

section_title: Punishment for committing affray
section_text: Whoever commits affray shall be punished.

section_title: Public servant taking gratification other than legal remuneration
section_text: A public servant taking gratification other than legal remuneration in respect of an official act commits an offence.

section_title: Taking gratification to influence public servant
section_text: Whoever takes gratification to influence a public servant commits an offence.

section_title: Taking gratification for exercise of personal influence
section_text: Whoever takes gratification for exercising personal influence over a public servant commits an offence.

section_title: Punishment for abetment by public servant of offences defined in section 162 or 163
section_text: Punishment is provided for abetment by public servant of offences under sections 162 or 163.

section_title: Public servant obtaining valuable thing without consideration
section_text: A public servant obtaining any valuable thing without consideration commits an offence.

section_title: Punishment for abetment of offences defined in section 161 or 165
section_text: Punishment for abetment of offences relating to public servant gratification.

section_title: Public servant disobeying law with intent to cause injury
section_text: A public servant disobeying law with intent to cause injury commits an offence.

section_title: Public servant disobeying direction under law
section_text: Public servant disobeying legal direction commits an offence.

section_title: Non-treatment of victim
section_text: Failure of public servant to provide treatment to victim is punishable.

section_title: Public servant framing incorrect document
section_text: Public servant framing incorrect document with intent to cause injury commits an offence.

section_title: Public servant unlawfully engaging in trade
section_text: A public servant unlawfully engaging in trade commits an offence.

section_title: Public servant unlawfully buying or bidding for property
section_text: Public servant unlawfully buying or bidding for property commits an offence.

section_title: Personating a public servant
section_text: Whoever pretends to hold office as a public servant commits an offence.

section_title: Wearing garb or carrying token used by public servant
section_text: Wearing garb or token used by public servant with intent to deceive is punishable.

section_title: Candidate
section_text: Candidate means a person who has been nominated as a candidate at an election.

section_title: Bribery
section_text: Bribery at elections is defined as giving or receiving gratification.

section_title: Undue influence at elections
section_text: Undue influence at elections includes interference with free exercise of electoral right.

section_title: Personation at elections
section_text: Personation at elections is punishable.

section_title: Punishment for bribery
section_text: Punishment for bribery at elections is provided.

section_title: Punishment for undue influence or personation
section_text: Punishment for undue influence or personation at elections.

section_title: False statement in connection with election
section_text: Making false statements in elections is punishable.

section_title: Illegal payments in connection with elections
section_text: Illegal payments in elections are punishable.

section_title: Failure to keep election accounts
section_text: Failure to keep election accounts is punishable.

section_title: Absconding to avoid service of summons or other proceeding
section_text: Whoever absconds to avoid being served with a summons notice or other legal process commits an offence.

section_title: Preventing service of summons or other proceeding or preventing publication thereof
section_text: Whoever intentionally prevents the service or publication of any summons or notice commits an offence.

section_title: Non-attendance in obedience to an order from public servant
section_text: Whoever fails to attend in obedience to a summons or order issued by a public servant commits an offence.

section_title: Omission to produce document to public servant by person legally bound to produce it
section_text: Whoever omits to produce a document which he is legally bound to produce commits an offence.

section_title: Omission to give notice or information to public servant by person legally bound to give it
section_text: Whoever omits to give notice or information which he is legally bound to give commits an offence.

section_title: Furnishing false information
section_text: Whoever furnishes information which he knows or believes to be false commits an offence.

section_title: Refusing oath or affirmation when duly required by public servant
section_text: Whoever refuses to take oath or affirmation when required commits an offence.

section_title: Refusing to answer public servant authorised to question
section_text: Whoever refuses to answer questions legally required by a public servant commits an offence.

section_title: Refusing to sign statement
section_text: Whoever refuses to sign a statement when legally required commits an offence.

section_title: False statement on oath or affirmation
section_text: Whoever makes a false statement on oath or affirmation commits an offence.

section_title: False information with intent to cause public servant to use lawful power to injury
section_text: Whoever gives false information to cause a public servant to misuse lawful power commits an offence.

section_title: Resistance to taking of property by lawful authority
section_text: Whoever resists the lawful taking of property by authority commits an offence.

section_title: Obstructing sale of property offered for sale by authority
section_text: Whoever obstructs the lawful sale of property commits an offence.

section_title: Illegal purchase or bid at sale by authority
section_text: Whoever illegally purchases or bids at sale by authority commits an offence.

section_title: Obstructing public servant in discharge of public functions
section_text: Whoever voluntarily obstructs a public servant in discharge of public functions commits an offence.

section_title: Omission to assist public servant
section_text: Whoever omits to assist a public servant when legally bound commits an offence.

section_title: Disobedience to order duly promulgated by public servant
section_text: Whoever disobeys an order promulgated by a public servant commits an offence.

section_title: Threat of injury to public servant
section_text: Whoever threatens injury to a public servant to influence official conduct commits an offence.

section_title: Threat of injury to induce person to refrain from applying for protection
section_text: Whoever threatens injury to induce a person to refrain from seeking lawful protection commits an offence.

section_title: Giving false evidence
section_text: Whoever is legally bound to state the truth and gives false evidence commits an offence.

section_title: Fabricating false evidence
section_text: Whoever causes any circumstance to exist or makes any false entry with intent that such circumstance or entry may appear in evidence commits an offence.

section_title: Punishment for false evidence
section_text: Whoever intentionally gives false evidence or fabricates false evidence shall be punished.

section_title: Giving or fabricating false evidence with intent to procure conviction of capital offence
section_text: False evidence given with intent to procure conviction for capital offence is punishable.

section_title: Giving or fabricating false evidence with intent to procure conviction of offence punishable with imprisonment for life
section_text: False evidence to procure conviction for life imprisonment is punishable.

section_title: Using evidence known to be false
section_text: Whoever uses evidence knowing it to be false commits an offence.

section_title: Issuing or signing false certificate
section_text: Whoever issues or signs a false certificate commits an offence.

section_title: Using as true a certificate known to be false

section_text: Whoever makes a false statement in any declaration commits an offence.

section_title: Using as true such declaration knowing it to be false
section_text: Whoever uses a false declaration as true commits an offence.

section_text: Whoever causes evidence to disappear to screen offender commits an offence.

section_title: Intentional omission to give information of offence
section_text: Whoever intentionally omits to give information of offence commits an offence.

section_title: Giving false information respecting an offence committed
section_text: Whoever gives false information respecting an offence commits an offence.

section_title: Destruction of document to prevent its production as evidence
section_text: Whoever destroys a document to prevent its use as evidence commits an offence.

section_title: False personation for purpose of act or proceeding in suit
section_text: Whoever falsely personates in a suit or proceeding commits an offence.

section_text: Fraudulent removal or concealment of property to prevent seizure commits an offence.

section_text: Fraudulent claim to property to prevent seizure commits an offence.

section_title: Dishonestly making false claim in court
section_text: Whoever dishonestly makes a false claim in court commits an offence.

section_text: Whoever institutes false criminal proceedings commits an offence.

section_title: False charge of offence made with intent to injure
section_text: False charge of offence with intent to injure is punishable.

section_text: Taking gift to screen an offender commits an offence.

section_text: Offering gift to screen an offender commits an offence.

section_title: Taking gift to help offender escape punishment
section_text: Taking gift to help offender escape punishment commits an offence.

section_title: Harbouring offender who has escaped from custody
section_text: Harbouring an offender who escaped from custody commits an offence.

section_title: Penalty for harbouring robbers or dacoits
section_text: Harbouring robbers or dacoits is punishable.

section_text: Public servant disobeying law to save person from punishment commits an offence.

section_text: Public servant framing incorrect record commits an offence.

section_title: Public servant corruptly making report
section_text: Public servant corruptly making report commits an offence.

section_title: Commitment for trial or confinement by person having authority who knows that he is acting contrary to law
section_text: Illegal confinement by authority is punishable.

section_title: Intentional omission to apprehend offender by public servant
section_text: Public servant omitting to apprehend offender commits an offence.

section_title: Intentional omission to apprehend offender by public servant on pecuniary consideration
section_text: Omission to apprehend offender for gain commits an offence.

section_title: Escape from confinement negligently suffered by public servant
section_text: Negligent escape from confinement by public servant commits an offence.

section_text: Resistance to lawful arrest commits an offence.

section_text: Resistance to lawful apprehension of another commits an offence.

section_text: Resistance to apprehension of person charged with offence commits an offence.

section_text: Resistance to apprehension for capital offence commits an offence.

section_text: Unlawful return from transportation commits an offence.

section_title: Violation of condition of remission of punishment
section_text: Violation of condition of remission commits an offence.

section_title: Intentional insult or interruption to public servant sitting in judicial proceeding
section_text: Intentional insult to public servant during judicial proceeding commits an offence.

section_text: Disclosure of identity of victim of certain offences is punishable.

section_title: Coin defined
section_text: Coin is metal used for money and stamped by authority of Government.

section_text: Whoever counterfeits or knowingly performs any part of the process of counterfeiting coin commits an offence.

section_text: Whoever counterfeits Indian coin commits an offence.

section_text: Whoever makes or sells instruments for counterfeiting coin commits an offence.

section_text: Whoever makes or sells instruments for counterfeiting Indian coin commits an offence.

section_title: Possession of instrument or material for purpose of using same for counterfeiting coin
section_text: Possession of instruments or materials for counterfeiting coin commits an offence.

section_title: Abetting in India the counterfeiting out of India of coin
section_text: Abetment in India of counterfeiting coin outside India is punishable.

section_title: Import or export of counterfeit coin
section_text: Importing or exporting counterfeit coin commits an offence.

section_title: Import or export of Indian counterfeit coin
section_text: Importing or exporting Indian counterfeit coin commits an offence.

section_title: Delivery of coin possessed with knowledge that it is counterfeit
section_text: Delivering counterfeit coin knowingly commits an offence.

section_title: Delivery of Indian coin possessed with knowledge that it is counterfeit
section_text: Delivering Indian counterfeit coin knowingly commits an offence.

section_title: Possession of counterfeit coin by person who knew it to be counterfeit when he became possessed thereof
section_text: Possession of counterfeit coin knowingly commits an offence.

section_title: Possession of Indian counterfeit coin
section_text: Possession of Indian counterfeit coin knowingly commits an offence.

section_title: Possession of instrument or material for counterfeiting Indian coin
section_text: Possession of instruments or material for counterfeiting Indian coin commits an offence.

section_title: Person employed in mint causing coin to be of different weight or composition
section_text: Mint employee causing coin variation commits an offence.

section_title: Unlawfully taking coining instrument from mint
section_text: Unlawfully taking coining instruments from mint commits an offence.

section_title: Fraudulently or dishonestly diminishing weight or altering composition of coin
section_text: Altering weight or composition of coin fraudulently commits an offence.

section_title: Fraudulently or dishonestly diminishing weight or altering composition of Indian coin
section_text: Altering Indian coin fraudulently commits an offence.

section_title: Altering appearance of coin with intent that it shall pass as coin of different description
section_text: Altering appearance of coin to pass as another commits an offence.

section_title: Altering appearance of Indian coin
section_text: Altering appearance of Indian coin commits an offence.

section_title: Delivery of coin as genuine which when first possessed was counterfeit
section_text: Delivering counterfeit coin as genuine commits an offence.

section_title: Delivery of Indian coin as genuine which when first possessed was counterfeit
section_text: Delivering Indian counterfeit coin as genuine commits an offence.

section_title: Possession of coin by person who knew it to be counterfeit when he became possessed thereof
section_text: Possession of coin knowingly counterfeit commits an offence.

section_title: Possession of Indian coin by person who knew it to be counterfeit when he became possessed thereof
section_text: Possession of Indian counterfeit coin knowingly commits an offence.

section_title: Delivery of coin possessed with knowledge that it is counterfeit
section_text: Delivery of counterfeit coin knowingly commits an offence.

section_title: Counterfeiting Government stamp
section_text: Counterfeiting Government stamp commits an offence.

section_title: Having possession of instrument or material for counterfeiting Government stamp
section_text: Possession of material for counterfeiting Government stamp commits an offence.

section_title: Making or selling instrument for counterfeiting Government stamp
section_text: Making or selling instrument for counterfeiting Government stamp commits an offence.

section_title: Sale of counterfeit Government stamp
section_text: Selling counterfeit Government stamp commits an offence.

section_title: Possession of counterfeit Government stamp
section_text: Possession of counterfeit Government stamp commits an offence.

section_title: Using as genuine a Government stamp known to be counterfeit
section_text: Using counterfeit Government stamp knowingly commits an offence.

section_title: Effacing writing from substance bearing Government stamp
section_text: Effacing writing from substance bearing Government stamp commits an offence.

section_title: Using Government stamp known to be previously used
section_text: Using previously used Government stamp commits an offence.

section_title: Erasure of mark denoting that stamp has been used
section_text: Erasing mark showing stamp has been used commits an offence.

section_title: Prohibition of fictitious stamps
section_text: Making or using fictitious stamps is prohibited.

section_title: Sale of fictitious stamps
section_text: Sale of fictitious stamps commits an offence.

section_title: Possession of fictitious stamps
section_text: Possession of fictitious stamps commits an offence.

section_title: Making or selling instrument for making fictitious stamps
section_text: Making or selling instruments for fictitious stamps commits an offence.

section_title: Public nuisance
section_text: A person is guilty of public nuisance who does any act or is guilty of an illegal omission which causes common injury danger or annoyance to the public.

section_title: Negligent act likely to spread infection of disease dangerous to life
section_text: Negligent act likely to spread infection dangerous to life is punishable.

section_title: Malignant act likely to spread infection of disease dangerous to life
section_text: Malignant act likely to spread infection dangerous to life is punishable.

section_title: Disobedience to quarantine rule
section_text: Disobedience to quarantine rule is punishable.

section_title: Adulteration of food or drink intended for sale
section_text: Adulteration of food or drink intended for sale is punishable.

section_title: Sale of noxious food or drink
section_text: Sale of noxious food or drink is punishable.

section_title: Adulteration of drugs
section_text: Adulteration of drugs is punishable.

section_title: Sale of adulterated drugs
section_text: Sale of adulterated drugs is punishable.

section_title: Sale of drug as a different drug
section_text: Sale of drug as a different drug is punishable.

section_title: Fouling water of public spring or reservoir
section_text: Fouling water of public spring or reservoir is punishable.

section_title: Making atmosphere noxious to health
section_text: Making atmosphere noxious to health is punishable.

section_title: Rash driving or riding on a public way
section_text: Rash or negligent driving on a public way is punishable.

section_title: Rash navigation of vessel
section_text: Rash navigation of vessel is punishable.

section_title: Exhibition of false light mark or buoy
section_text: Exhibiting false light mark or buoy is punishable.

section_title: Conveying person by water so rashly or negligently as to endanger human life
section_text: Rash or negligent conveyance by water endangering life is punishable.

section_title: Danger or obstruction in public way or line of navigation
section_text: Causing danger or obstruction in public way or navigation is punishable.

section_title: Negligent conduct with respect to poisonous substance
section_text: Negligent conduct with poisonous substance is punishable.

section_title: Negligent conduct with respect to fire or combustible matter
section_text: Negligent conduct with fire or combustible matter is punishable.

section_title: Negligent conduct with respect to explosive substance
section_text: Negligent conduct with explosive substance is punishable.

section_title: Negligent conduct with respect to machinery
section_text: Negligent conduct with machinery is punishable.

section_title: Negligent conduct with respect to pulling down or repairing buildings
section_text: Negligent conduct during building repair is punishable.

section_title: Negligent conduct with respect to animal
section_text: Negligent conduct with animal is punishable.

section_title: Punishment for public nuisance in cases not otherwise provided for
section_text: Punishment for public nuisance where no specific punishment is provided.

section_title: Continuance of nuisance after injunction to discontinue
section_text: Continuing nuisance after injunction is punishable.

section_title: Sale etc of obscene books
section_text: Sale or distribution of obscene books is punishable.

section_title: Sale etc of obscene objects to young persons
section_text: Sale of obscene objects to young persons is punishable.

section_title: Obscene acts and songs
section_text: Obscene acts and songs in public places are punishable.

section_title: Keeping lottery office
section_text: Keeping a lottery office is punishable.

section_title: Injuring or defiling place of worship with intent to insult religion
section_text: Whoever destroys damages or defiles any place of worship or sacred object with intent to insult religion commits an offence.

section_title: Deliberate and malicious acts intended to outrage religious feelings
section_text: Deliberate and malicious acts intended to outrage religious feelings of any class by words signs or representations are punishable.

section_title: Disturbing religious assembly
section_text: Whoever voluntarily causes disturbance to a religious assembly commits an offence.

section_title: Trespassing on burial places
section_text: Whoever trespasses on burial places or places set apart for funeral rites commits an offence.

section_title: Uttering words with deliberate intent to wound religious feelings
section_text: Uttering words with deliberate intent to wound religious feelings of any person is punishable.

section_title: Culpable homicide
section_text: Whoever causes death by doing an act with intention of causing death or such bodily injury as is likely to cause death commits culpable homicide.

section_title: Murder
section_text: Culpable homicide is murder if the act falls within the conditions defined in this section.

section_title: Culpable homicide by causing death of person other than person whose death was intended
section_text: Causing death of a person other than intended still amounts to culpable homicide.

section_title: Punishment for murder
section_text: Whoever commits murder shall be punished with death or imprisonment for life.

section_title: Punishment for murder by life convict
section_text: Whoever being under sentence of life imprisonment commits murder shall be punished.

section_title: Punishment for culpable homicide not amounting to murder
section_text: Punishment for culpable homicide not amounting to murder is provided.

section_title: Causing death by negligence
section_text: Whoever causes death by a rash or negligent act not amounting to culpable homicide commits an offence.

section_title: Abetment of suicide of child or insane person
section_text: Abetment of suicide of a child or insane person is punishable.

section_title: Abetment of suicide
section_text: Whoever abets the commission of suicide shall be punished.

section_title: Attempt to murder
section_text: Whoever does any act with intention or knowledge and under circumstances that if he caused death he would be guilty of murder commits attempt to murder.

section_title: Attempt to commit culpable homicide
section_text: Attempt to commit culpable homicide not amounting to murder is punishable.

section_title: Attempt to commit suicide
section_text: Whoever attempts to commit suicide and does any act towards it commits an offence.

section_title: Thug
section_text: A thug is a person who commits robbery or dacoity with murder.

section_title: Punishment
section_text: Punishment for offences relating to thug is provided.

section_title: Causing miscarriage
section_text: Whoever voluntarily causes a woman with child to miscarry commits an offence.

section_title: Causing miscarriage without woman's consent
section_text: Causing miscarriage without consent of woman is punishable.

section_title: Death caused by act done with intent to cause miscarriage
section_text: Causing death by act intended to cause miscarriage commits an offence.

section_title: Act done with intent to prevent child being born alive
section_text: Act done to prevent child being born alive commits an offence.

section_title: Causing death of quick unborn child
section_text: Causing death of a quick unborn child commits an offence.

section_title: Exposure and abandonment of child under twelve years by parent or person having care of it
section_text: Whoever being the father or mother of a child under the age of twelve years or having the care of such child exposes or leaves such child with the intention of wholly abandoning it commits an offence.

section_title: Concealment of birth by secret disposal of dead body
section_text: Whoever secretly buries or disposes of the dead body of a child whether such child died before or after birth commits an offence.

section_title: Hurt
section_text: Whoever causes bodily pain disease or infirmity to any person is said to cause hurt.

section_title: Grievous hurt
section_text: The following kinds of hurt only are designated as grievous hurt as enumerated in this section.

section_title: Voluntarily causing hurt
section_text: Whoever does any act with the intention of thereby causing hurt or with the knowledge that he is likely thereby to cause hurt commits an offence.

section_title: Voluntarily causing grievous hurt
section_text: Whoever voluntarily causes grievous hurt commits an offence.

section_title: Punishment for voluntarily causing hurt
section_text: Whoever voluntarily causes hurt shall be punished as provided in this section.

section_title: Voluntarily causing hurt by dangerous weapons or means
section_text: Whoever voluntarily causes hurt by means of dangerous weapons or means commits an offence.

section_title: Punishment for voluntarily causing grievous hurt
section_text: Whoever voluntarily causes grievous hurt shall be punished as provided in this section.

section_title: Voluntarily causing grievous hurt by dangerous weapons or means
section_text: Whoever voluntarily causes grievous hurt by dangerous weapons or means commits an offence.

section_title: Voluntarily causing hurt to extort property or constrain to illegal act
section_text: Whoever voluntarily causes hurt to extort property or constrain a person to an illegal act commits an offence.

section_title: Causing hurt by means of poison etc with intent to commit offence
section_text: Whoever administers poison or any stupefying intoxicating or unwholesome drug with intent to cause hurt commits an offence.

section_title: Voluntarily causing grievous hurt to extort property or constrain to illegal act
section_text: Whoever voluntarily causes grievous hurt to extort property or constrain a person to an illegal act commits an offence.

section_title: Voluntarily causing hurt to extort confession or information
section_text: Whoever voluntarily causes hurt to extort confession or information commits an offence.

section_title: Voluntarily causing grievous hurt to extort confession or information
section_text: Whoever voluntarily causes grievous hurt to extort confession or information commits an offence.

section_title: Voluntarily causing hurt to deter public servant from duty
section_text: Whoever voluntarily causes hurt to deter or prevent a public servant from discharge of his duty commits an offence.

section_title: Voluntarily causing grievous hurt to deter public servant from duty
section_text: Whoever voluntarily causes grievous hurt to deter or prevent a public servant from discharge of his duty commits an offence.

section_title: Voluntarily causing hurt on provocation
section_text: Whoever voluntarily causes hurt on grave and sudden provocation commits an offence.

section_title: Voluntarily causing grievous hurt on provocation
section_text: Whoever voluntarily causes grievous hurt on grave and sudden provocation commits an offence.

section_title: Act endangering life or personal safety of others
section_text: Whoever does any act so rashly or negligently as to endanger human life or the personal safety of others commits an offence.

section_title: Causing hurt by act endangering life or personal safety of others
section_text: Whoever causes hurt by doing any act so rashly or negligently as to endanger human life commits an offence.

section_title: Causing grievous hurt by act endangering life or personal safety of others
section_text: Whoever causes grievous hurt by doing any act so rashly or negligently as to endanger human life commits an offence.

section_title: Wrongful restraint
section_text: Whoever voluntarily obstructs any person so as to prevent that person from proceeding in any direction in which that person has a right to proceed commits an offence.

section_title: Wrongful confinement
section_text: Whoever wrongfully restrains any person in such a manner as to prevent that person from proceeding beyond certain circumscribing limits commits an offence.

section_title: Punishment for wrongful restraint
section_text: Whoever wrongfully restrains any person shall be punished as provided in this section.

section_title: Punishment for wrongful confinement
section_text: Whoever wrongfully confines any person shall be punished as provided in this section.

section_title: Wrongful confinement for three or more days
section_text: Whoever wrongfully confines any person for three or more days commits an offence.

section_title: Wrongful confinement for ten or more days
section_text: Whoever wrongfully confines any person for ten or more days commits an offence.

section_title: Wrongful confinement of person for whose liberation writ has been issued
section_text: Whoever wrongfully confines a person for whose liberation a writ has been issued commits an offence.

section_title: Wrongful confinement in secret
section_text: Whoever wrongfully confines a person in secret commits an offence.

section_title: Wrongful confinement to extort property or constrain to illegal act
section_text: Whoever wrongfully confines a person to extort property or constrain to illegal act commits an offence.

section_title: Wrongful confinement to extort confession or information
section_text: Whoever wrongfully confines a person to extort confession or information commits an offence.

section_title: Force
section_text: A person is said to use force if he causes motion change of motion or cessation of motion to another.

section_title: Criminal force
section_text: Whoever intentionally uses force to any person without consent in order to cause injury fear or annoyance commits criminal force.

section_title: Assault
section_text: Whoever makes any gesture or preparation intending or knowing it to be likely to cause apprehension of criminal force commits assault.

section_title: Punishment for assault or criminal force otherwise than on grave provocation
section_text: Whoever commits assault or criminal force otherwise than on grave provocation shall be punished.

section_title: Assault or criminal force to deter public servant from discharge of his duty
section_text: Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to deter a public servant from duty commits an offence.

section_title: Assault or criminal force to woman with intent to outrage her modesty
section_text: Whoever assaults or uses criminal force to a woman intending to outrage her modesty commits an offence.

section_title: Sexual harassment
section_text: Sexual harassment includes unwelcome physical contact and advances or demand for sexual favours.

section_title: Assault or use of criminal force to woman with intent to disrobe
section_text: Assault or use of criminal force to disrobe a woman commits an offence.

section_title: Voyeurism
section_text: Watching or capturing image of a woman engaged in a private act without consent commits an offence.

section_title: Stalking
section_text: Following or contacting a woman repeatedly despite clear indication of disinterest commits an offence.

section_title: Assault or criminal force with intent to dishonour person otherwise than on grave provocation
section_text: Whoever assaults or uses criminal force with intent to dishonour a person commits an offence.

section_title: Assault or criminal force in attempt to commit theft of property carried by person
section_text: Whoever assaults or uses criminal force in attempt to commit theft commits an offence.

section_title: Assault or criminal force in attempt wrongfully to confine person
section_text: Whoever assaults or uses criminal force in attempt to wrongfully confine a person commits an offence.

section_title: Assault or criminal force on grave provocation
section_text: Whoever assaults or uses criminal force on grave and sudden provocation commits an offence.

section_title: Kidnapping
section_text: Kidnapping is of two kinds kidnapping from India and kidnapping from lawful guardianship.

section_title: Kidnapping from India
section_text: Whoever conveys any person beyond the limits of India without consent commits kidnapping.

section_title: Kidnapping from lawful guardianship
section_text: Whoever takes or entices a minor or person of unsound mind from lawful guardianship commits kidnapping.

section_title: Abduction
section_text: Whoever by force or deceit compels any person to go from any place commits abduction.

section_title: Punishment for kidnapping
section_text: Whoever kidnaps any person shall be punished as provided in this section.

section_title: Kidnapping or abducting in order to murder
section_text: Whoever kidnaps or abducts a person in order that such person may be murdered commits an offence.

section_title: Kidnapping for ransom
section_text: Whoever kidnaps or abducts any person and threatens to cause death or hurt in order to compel payment of ransom commits an offence.

section_title: Kidnapping or abducting with intent secretly and wrongfully to confine person
section_text: Whoever kidnaps or abducts any person with intent to secretly and wrongfully confine such person commits an offence.

section_title: Kidnapping abducting or inducing woman to compel her marriage
section_text: Whoever kidnaps or abducts a woman to compel her marriage or illicit intercourse commits an offence.

section_title: Procuration of minor girl
section_text: Whoever induces a minor girl to go from any place with intent that she may be forced into illicit intercourse commits an offence.

section_title: Importation of girl from foreign country
section_text: Whoever imports a girl under the age of twenty-one years from any foreign country for illicit intercourse commits an offence.

section_title: Kidnapping abducting in order to subject person to grievous hurt slavery etc
section_text: Whoever kidnaps or abducts any person to subject them to grievous hurt slavery or unnatural lust commits an offence.

section_title: Wrongfully concealing or keeping in confinement kidnapped person
section_text: Whoever wrongfully conceals or keeps in confinement any kidnapped or abducted person commits an offence.

section_title: Kidnapping abducting child under ten years with intent to steal property
section_text: Whoever kidnaps or abducts a child under ten years with intent to steal property commits an offence.

section_title: Trafficking of person
section_text: Whoever for the purpose of exploitation recruits transports harbours transfers or receives a person commits trafficking.

section_title: Exploitation of a trafficked person
section_text: Whoever knowingly engages a trafficked person for sexual exploitation commits an offence.

section_title: Habitual dealing in slaves
section_text: Whoever habitually imports exports removes buys sells traffics or deals in slaves commits an offence.

section_title: Selling minor for purposes of prostitution
section_text: Whoever sells or lets to hire a minor for prostitution commits an offence.

section_title: Buying minor for purposes of prostitution
section_text: Whoever buys or hires a minor for prostitution commits an offence.

section_title: Unlawful compulsory labour
section_text: Whoever unlawfully compels any person to labour against his will commits an offence.

section_title: Rape
section_text: A man is said to commit rape if he commits sexual intercourse under circumstances falling within this section.

section_title: Punishment for rape
section_text: Whoever commits rape shall be punished with rigorous imprisonment as provided in this section.

section_title: Punishment for causing death or persistent vegetative state of victim
section_text: Whoever causes death or persistent vegetative state during rape commits an offence.

section_title: Sexual intercourse by husband upon his wife during separation
section_text: Sexual intercourse by husband upon his wife during separation is punishable.

section_title: Sexual intercourse by person in authority
section_text: Sexual intercourse by a person in authority commits an offence.

section_title: Gang rape
section_text: When a woman is raped by one or more persons acting in furtherance of common intention it is gang rape.

section_title: Gang rape on woman under sixteen years of age
section_text: Gang rape of a woman under sixteen years of age commits an offence.

section_title: Gang rape on woman under twelve years of age
section_text: Gang rape of a woman under twelve years of age commits an offence.

section_title: Unnatural offences
section_text: Whoever voluntarily has carnal intercourse against the order of nature commits an offence.

section_title: Theft
section_text: Whoever intending to take dishonestly any movable property out of the possession of any person without that person's consent moves that property commits theft.

section_title: Punishment for theft
section_text: Whoever commits theft shall be punished as provided in this section.

section_title: Theft in dwelling house
section_text: Whoever commits theft in any building tent or vessel used as a human dwelling commits an offence.

section_title: Theft by clerk or servant of property in possession of master
section_text: Whoever being a clerk or servant commits theft of property in possession of his master commits an offence.

section_title: Theft after preparation made for causing death hurt or restraint
section_text: Whoever commits theft after making preparation for causing death hurt or restraint commits an offence.

section_title: Extortion
section_text: Whoever intentionally puts any person in fear of injury and thereby dishonestly induces that person to deliver property commits extortion.

section_title: Punishment for extortion
section_text: Whoever commits extortion shall be punished as provided in this section.

section_title: Putting person in fear of injury in order to commit extortion
section_text: Whoever puts or attempts to put any person in fear of injury in order to commit extortion commits an offence.

section_title: Extortion by putting a person in fear of death or grievous hurt
section_text: Whoever commits extortion by putting a person in fear of death or grievous hurt commits an offence.

section_title: Putting person in fear of death or grievous hurt in order to commit extortion
section_text: Whoever puts or attempts to put a person in fear of death or grievous hurt to commit extortion commits an offence.

section_title: Extortion by threat of accusation of an offence punishable with death or life imprisonment
section_text: Whoever commits extortion by threat of accusation of an offence punishable with death or life imprisonment commits an offence.

section_title: Putting person in fear of accusation of offence in order to commit extortion
section_text: Whoever puts a person in fear of accusation of offence in order to commit extortion commits an offence.

section_title: Robbery
section_text: In all robbery there is either theft or extortion combined with violence or fear of instant violence.

section_title: Dacoity
section_text: When five or more persons conjointly commit or attempt to commit robbery it is dacoity.

section_title: Punishment for robbery
section_text: Whoever commits robbery shall be punished as provided in this section.

section_title: Attempt to commit robbery
section_text: Whoever attempts to commit robbery commits an offence.

section_title: Voluntarily causing hurt in committing robbery
section_text: Whoever voluntarily causes hurt in committing robbery commits an offence.

section_title: Punishment for dacoity
section_text: Whoever commits dacoity shall be punished as provided in this section.

section_title: Dacoity with murder
section_text: If any one of five or more persons committing dacoity commits murder every one of them commits an offence.

section_title: Robbery or dacoity with attempt to cause death or grievous hurt
section_text: Robbery or dacoity with use of deadly weapon or attempt to cause death commits an offence.

section_title: Attempt to commit robbery or dacoity when armed with deadly weapon
section_text: Attempt to commit robbery or dacoity while armed with deadly weapon commits an offence.

section_title: Making preparation to commit dacoity
